page.title: 18ARMY BANDS
page.content: THE ROYAL MARINES LIGHT INFANTRY CADET MARCHING BAND WAS FORMED IN 1979. IT IS BASED AT FORT BROCKHURST AND HAS BOTH BOYS AND GIRLS AGED FROM 8-16 IN THE SQUAD. THE INSTRUMENTS PLAYED BY THE BAND INCLUDE SIDE-DRUMS, BIG-BASS-DRUMS, BUGLES, SAXAPHONES, CLARINETS, TROMBONES, XYLOPHONES AND TUBAS. THE BAND WAS FORMED TO COMMEMORATE THE R.M.L.I. WHO WERE STATIONED AT FORTON BARRACKS FROM 1848 UNTIL1923. IT HAS PERFORMED BEFORE ROYALTY AND HAS APPEARED SEVERAL TIMES ON TELEVISION. IN 1984 AND 1985 IT APPEARED AT THE ROYAL TOURNAMENT IN LONDON. THE PAST YEAR HAS BEEN EVENTFUL FOR THE ROYAL MARINES LIGHT INFANTRY CADET DRILL SQUAD. AS WELL AS UNDERTAKING GUARD AND CEREMONIAL DUTIES, THE SQUAD HAS BECOME A PERFORMING UNIT IN ITS OWN RIGHT.
